grumble grumble That'll teach me to reply to a post when I'm tired. I didn't mean what you said Red Iron Crown, I meant what StrandedonEarth was talking about with. The fact that when an aircraft disappears it's black boxes are not recovered.

Answers to the clues

Over and over it loops back around; Cockpit voice recorders are set to a 30 minute loop of recording, which is why they only record the last 30 minutes of a flight.

Yet in disaster will always be found; Where physically possible the black boxes are always recovered.

An endless cycle hoped never to break; If the 30 minute loop is broken that means that the aircraft has crashed. Not something that you want to be hoping for.

A priceless clue potential to make; The data it records has been instrumental in solving plane crashes in the past.

With a name not of it's description; As StrandedonEarth said it is called the black box, however to aid in the recovery of them they are usually painted bright orange.

Final words within its encryption; The final words of the pilot are recorded on the cockpit voice recorder.

For years I have evolved; The design of the cockpit voice recorder has changed over the years not only to record more information but also to improve the impact tolerance of it.

As a clue for crashes that must be solved; Basically a rehash of line 4.
